intro: Fumanopsis laevipes, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed fumanopsis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, smooth stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
